Does Sydney Money Changing have AML/CTF obligations under the Act?

Scenario

Sydney Money Changing is a local money changing service owned by Andrew Smith. Andrew is in charge of about eight employees and is responsible for ensuring that the business is compliant with anti-money laundering obligations.  

 

One day Andrew deals with a customer named Simon, who asks him to exchange $9500 into Swiss francs. Simon tells Andrew that he plans to take the $9500 worth out of Australia to Switzerland on a business trip.

No, it is exempt from its anti-money laundering and counter- terrorism financing obligations

Yes, Andrew's business provides a designated service

Yes, but it is partially exempt from its AML obligations  

 
 
 

That is incorrect

 

The Act applies to all Australian-linked individuals and businesses that provide a "designated service". The currency change service provided by Andrew is a designated service that is not exempt from AML/CTF reporting obligations.

That is correct!

 

The Act applies to all Australian-linked individuals and businesses that provide a "designated service". The currency change service provided by Andrew is a designated service that is not exempt from AML/CTF reporting obligations.

That is incorrect

 

The Act applies to all Australian-linked individuals and businesses that provide a "designated service". The currency change service provided by Andrew is a designated service that is not exempt from AML/CTF reporting obligations.
